action.action-desc: Ms. Brownley introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To provide assistance for surface transportation projects relating to international Olympic, Paralympic, and Special Olympics events.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Transportation Assistance for Olympic Cities Act of 2022.

section.header: Transportation assistance for Olympic, Paralympic, and Special Olympics cities

subsection.text: The purpose of this section is to prioritize and support State and local efforts on surface transportation issues necessary to obtain the national recognition and economic benefits of participation in the international Olympic, Paralympic, and Special Olympics movement by hosting international Olympic, Paralympic, and Special Olympics events in the United States.

subparagraph.text: The term covered event means an international Olympic, Paralympic, or Special Olympics event held at a site that has been selected to hold such event.
The term covered event does not include activities relating to preparing or submitting a bid to be selected to hold an international Olympic, Paralympic, or Special Olympics event.

paragraph.text: The term Secretary means the Secretary of Transportation.

subsection.header: Priority for transportation projects relating to Olympic, Paralympic, and Special Olympics events

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, in providing grants for surface transportation projects described in paragraph (2), the Secretary may give priority to a surface transportation project relating to a covered event.
A grant referred to in paragraph (1) is a discretionary grant for a surface transportation project—

subparagraph.text: under title 23 or 49, United States Code, beginning on the date of enactment of this Act; or
otherwise administered by the Secretary for surface transportation projects.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall take all reasonable efforts to provide assistance to a covered event, including—

paragraph.text: by providing assistance for planning activities of States and metropolitan planning organizations under sections 134 and 135 of title 23, United States Code, for surface transportation projects relating to a covered event;
by developing intermodal transportation plans in coordination with States and local transportation agencies;
by expediting review and comment of any required submissions to the Secretary relating to a covered event; and

subsection.header: Transportation projects relating to Olympic, Paralympic, and Special Olympics events

paragraph.text: The Secretary may provide assistance, including planning, capital, and operating assistance, to a State or unit of local government in carrying out surface transportation projects relating to a covered event.

Notwithstanding any other provision of law, any funding provided in accordance with this section may be used for any temporary facility, equipment, operations, and maintenance that meets the extraordinary surface transportation needs associated with hosting a covered event.
There are authorized to be appropriated to carry out this section such sums as are necessary for each of fiscal years 2022 through 2034.

Any amounts provided to a State or unit of local government in accordance with this section shall be in addition to any Federal funds otherwise available to the State or unit of local government for the surface transportation project.

subsection.text: The authority provided by this section shall terminate on September 30, 2034.
